Class StandardRules

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rules
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoseByConnectingRules, OverwriteRules

    public class StandardRules
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rules
    StandardRules implementation, every game will probably use this.

      • checkForWins

        public PlayerColor checkForWins()
        Checks the wins for the red and blue players. If a win exists for either of them, the winning player is returned. If the game is not yet won, null is returned. A tie would be indicated by PlayerColor.BLANK
        Specified by:
        checkForWins in interface Rules
        Returns:
        the PlayerColor of the winning player, null if neither player has won

      • isLegalMove

        public boolean isLegalMove(Move move)
        Takes a move and checks legality, returning whether or not the move can be executed by the current player. Rules should police whether a player can make a move. Just because a player wants to go somewhere doesn't mean they get to, and isLegalMove is the check against this. For example, in the standard rules for Trails a player cannot move to a tile on the board that another player has already moved to.
        Specified by:
        isLegalMove in interface Rules
        Parameters:
        move - The move to check legality on.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Move move)
              throws InvalidMoveException
        This method takes a move and modifies the board associated with these rules in order to execute that move. If the move is invalid, throw and InvalidMoveException
        Specified by:
        makeMove in interface Rules
        Parameters:
        move - the Move to make
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - when the move cannot be legally made

      • getLegalMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getLegalMoves(Player player)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
